H0.text: Cooling temperatures is the process by which an igneous rock forms in the rock cycle.

H1.text: High pressure and heat are the conditions from which an igneous rock forms in the rock cycle.

H2.text: Weathering and erosion form igneous rocks in the rock cycle.

H3.text: Compacted plant remains are the material from which an igneous rock forms in the rock cycle.

A4.text: Igneous rocks are formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava.

A5.text: When exposed by erosion, these cores (called batholiths) may occupy huge areas of the Earth's surface.
